smells.description: Smell fittizio inserito per provare l'interfaccia di Prompt Engineering (UC02).
smells.draft_prompt:
Detect the code smell called "Pandas Chained Indexing" (often called "Chain Indexing").

DEFINITION:
A Pandas Chained Indexing smell occurs when a pandas DataFrame is accessed with two consecutive bracket indexers, typically like df[col][row] or df[mask][col].
This is problematic because it can return a view vs copy unpredictably and can cause SettingWithCopy issues.
Preferred alternatives are explicit indexers, e.g. df.loc[row, col] or df.iloc[row, col].

DETECTION RULES:
- Flag any expression of the form: <df_expr>[...][...] (two consecutive bracket indexers).
- Treat BOTH reads and writes as findings.
- Scan the ENTIRE file and return ALL occurrences as separate findings (do not group).
- Be conservative to avoid false positives.
